overview_summary: None of these five adjacent landowners has taken a public position for or against the proposed development, so all are categorized with an unknown stance. Their community influence is limited – none hold prominent local roles, and all appear to be relatively new residents with modest public profiles.

neighbors.name: Samantha D. Harrell & Kenneth D. Harrell
neighbors.claims: The Harrells reside on Shawmont Road in Fredericksburg (Spotsylvania County) and their home was newly built around 2022 in the Thorburn Estates subdivision ([www.idcrawl.com](https://www.idcrawl.com/samantha-harrell#:~:text=IDCrawl%20www,yahoo.com%20%E2%80%94%20%28770%29%20789)) ([www.zillow.com](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/7805-Shawmont-Rd-Fredericksburg-VA-22407/2060441486_zpid/#:~:text=...Permanent%20,Subdivision%3A%20Thorburn%20Estates)). No references to Samantha or Kenneth Harrell engaging in local government meetings or community boards were found in public records ([www.spotsylvania.va.us](https://www.spotsylvania.va.us/1325/Members#:~:text=Members%20,Kevin%20Marshall%2C%20Berkeley%20District%20Board)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Begin with a friendly, informal introduction to share project information. Emphasize transparency and listen to any concerns privately, since they have not voiced opinions publicly.

neighbors.name: Sedat Elmali & Gulsah Elmali
neighbors.claims: Sedat “Sam” Elmali’s family moved from Delaware to Spotsylvania in 2012 to open a local restaurant (Four Seasons), indicating a small business presence in the community ([patch.com](https://patch.com/virginia/fredericksburg/four-seasons-is-a-labor-of-love-for-owner#:~:text=%E2%80%9CI%20get%20to%20the%20restaurant,%E2%80%9D)) ([patch.com](https://patch.com/virginia/fredericksburg/four-seasons-is-a-labor-of-love-for-owner#:~:text=Elmali%20found%20the%20restaurant%20building,1%20for%20years)). There is no public record of Sedat or Gulsah Elmali taking positions on development issues or serving in any official capacity in Spotsylvania ([www.spotsylvania.va.us](https://www.spotsylvania.va.us/1325/Members#:~:text=Members%20,Kevin%20Marshall%2C%20Berkeley%20District%20Board)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect through their business/community ties – for example, discuss the project when visiting local events or establishments. Highlight economic benefits and reassure them that community character and small-business climate will be respected.

neighbors.name: Latasha McGee & Marlon McGee
neighbors.claims: The McGees appear to have moved into Thorburn Estates recently, as their residence is part of a new-home development built in the early 2020s ([www.zillow.com](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/7805-Shawmont-Rd-Fredericksburg-VA-22407/2060441486_zpid/#:~:text=...Permanent%20,Subdivision%3A%20Thorburn%20Estates)). No mentions of Latasha or Marlon McGee participating in county meetings, local committees, or public commentary were located in available records ([www.spotsylvania.va.us](https://www.spotsylvania.va.us/1325/Members#:~:text=Members%20,Kevin%20Marshall%2C%20Berkeley%20District%20Board)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the McGees via neighborhood channels or informal meet-ups. Provide clear facts on how the development will maintain neighborhood quality (e.g., noise and traffic control) to address any unspoken worries common to new homeowners.

neighbors.name: Williams A. Asiamah
neighbors.claims: Williams Asiamah owns one of the newly constructed homes in the Thorburn Estates area of Spotsylvania (completed mid-2020s) ([www.zillow.com](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/7805-Shawmont-Rd-Fredericksburg-VA-22407/2060441486_zpid/#:~:text=...Permanent%20,Subdivision%3A%20Thorburn%20Estates)). He has no evident public profile in Spotsylvania County – no volunteer appointments, elected positions, or public statements on development are documented for him ([www.spotsylvania.va.us](https://www.spotsylvania.va.us/1325/Members#:~:text=Members%20,Kevin%20Marshall%2C%20Berkeley%20District%20Board)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Mr. Asiamah one-on-one with respect for his privacy. Sharing information about the project’s safety and long-term maintenance plans can build trust, as he has not been publicly involved and may appreciate a straightforward, factual discussion.

neighbors.name: Mark A. Symons & Ashley A. Symons
neighbors.claims: Mark and Ashley Symons purchased a 5-bedroom home on roughly 3.4 acres in July 2025, indicating they are very recent residents of the area ([www.redfin.com](https://www.redfin.com/VA/Fredericksburg/7802-Shawmont-Rd-22407/home/179937417#:~:text=SOLD%20ON%20JUL%2018%2C%202025)). They have not engaged in any public community activities or taken any known stance on development or energy projects in Spotsylvania to date ([www.spotsylvania.va.us](https://www.spotsylvania.va.us/1325/Members#:~:text=Members%20,Kevin%20Marshall%2C%20Berkeley%20District%20Board)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Very new residents; no public presence

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a community leader or well-regarded neighbor welcome the Symons and introduce the project informally. Emphasize that the development will be managed in a way that protects property values and the peaceful nature of the neighborhood, which are likely important to them as new homeowners.
